page.title: 16TOURISM ON ST.MARTINS I.O.S.
page.content: The income from tourism makes up about half of the islands economy. There are 32 cottages or chalets which are let.In a good season which lasts from a week before Easter to mid October,an owner gets on average 12 fortnightly bookings.There is also one guest house on St.Martins,with a tea rooms alongside which caters for day trippers from St.Marys.There is one camp site at Middletown.Visitors staying on St.Martins can visit the other islands on a passenger boat called Commodore,which can carry 76.Most holidaymakers come here for the peace and quiet,beauty,sandy beaches,lack of traffic and the generally relaxed atmosphere.They pursue interests such as bird watching fishing,sailing,diving,wind surfing and swimming.Many think it is an ideal place for a family holiday.
